Melissa Sharyn Ellis, the daughter of Alison and Richard S. Ellis of Amherst, Mass., was married last night to Kenneth Eli Glassman, the son of Cynthia Glassman and Dr. Leonard Glassman of Alexandria, Va. Rabbi Sheila Weinberg officiated at the Springfield Marriott Hotel in Springfield, Mass.
The couple graduated magna cum laude from Yale University, where they met.

Mrs. Glassman, 25, will graduate from Yale Medical School this month and then start a residency in pediatrics at the Columbia-Presbyterian Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital in New York. Her father is a professor of mathematics and statistics and an adjunct professor of Judaic and Near Eastern studies at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst. Her mother teaches the first grade at the Leverett (Mass.) Elementary School.

Mr. Glassman, 28, received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. He is a trader in high-yield bonds at Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. His mother works at Ernst & Young in Washington as a consultant to financial institutions on risk management and regulatory issues. His father, a former chief of radiology at the Columbia Hospital for Women in Washington, is a radiologist at Washington Radiology Associates there.
